instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.U7501: What is U7501? This chip is often responsible for creating PP3V3_S5,  PP3V3_S3,  PP3V3_S0,  PP5V_S5,  PP5V_S4,  PP5V_S0.
definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMC_TDO: What is SMC_TDO? SMC_TDO is a signal that must be pulled up to 3.42v in order for the SMC to be in the proper mode to function. Often this is not pulled up because of corrosion or corroded resistors by the SMC. .
definitions.U1950: What is U1950? This chip often becomes corroded on pin 8 on the PP3V42_G3H pin causing PM_SLP_S4_L to go missing.
definitions.U6100: What is U6100? this is an SPI ROM chip that holds the BIOS which is necessary for the machine to POST or try and power on..

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damaged, no 5V, <CHIP>U7501</CHIP> pin 4 no enable voltage, <RESISTOR>R7551</RESISTOR> is ok
threads.message: On a water damaged <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, macbook air 13, around the SMC there was 2 testpoints corroded away therefore the track was broken, <RESISTOR>R5193</RESISTOR> <SIGNAL>SMS_INT_L</SIGNAL> + <RESISTOR>R5178</RESISTOR> <SIGNAL>SMC_TDO</SIGNAL>, i fixed the tracks, the resistors were not corroded, both connects to PP3V42, which is there, before and after the resistors, i cleaned the board too, checked SMC balls under microscope, doesnt look dirty (the first row of balls what are visible), there is green light on charger, 3.3V and G3H 8.6V are ok, wont turn on, , only the 5V is missing, what else can i check, it seems that SMC is not enabling the 5V.  I dont have donor board with another SMC, hope its something else...

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damaged, no 5V, <CHIP>U7501</CHIP> pin 4 no enable voltage, <RESISTOR>R7551</RESISTOR> is ok
threads.message: Probably corrosion under the SMC, flux and heat it but not reflow. Also inspect <CHIP>U1900</CHIP>, <CHIP>U1950</CHIP> for corrosion. PPVRTC present? Corrosion around <CHIP>U6100</CHIP>?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damaged, no 5V, <CHIP>U7501</CHIP> pin 4 no enable voltage, <RESISTOR>R7551</RESISTOR> is ok
threads.message:
ur great! i checked them, there was corrosion on <CHIP>U1950</CHIP> and gate, on pin 1, its funny cause i checked it under the scope, but i was using an ext. led light which creates shadows on the board, the water damage was so small that it was hiding in the shadow created by the directional led light, i replaced that, was still no good, than just for the sake of it i replaced <CHIP>U7501</CHIP> (creating 3.3V and 5V) and it started. Did not recognise battery, i could not perform pram reset only smc reset, but pram reset is possible with ext. usb keyboard, and after that it recognized the battery and charging, and now i can perform pram reset with its own keyboard.
THX!!

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damaged, no 5V, <CHIP>U7501</CHIP> pin 4 no enable voltage, <RESISTOR>R7551</RESISTOR> is ok
threads.message: I can confirm that board works ok without <SIGNAL>SMS_INT_L</SIGNAL>
